verses.text: 伊施波設被刺殺掃羅的兒子伊施波設聽見押尼珥在希伯崙死了，就怕得手都發軟，以色列眾人也都驚惶失措。

words.note: Indicates passive voice.
Connects verb/adj to a complement of result or degree.
Describes hands becoming weak from fear.
Idiom meaning 'panic-stricken and not knowing what to do'.

verses.text: 掃羅的兒子伊施波設有兩個統率突擊隊的將領，一個名叫巴拿，一個名叫利甲，他們是便雅憫支派比錄人臨門的兒子。（比錄也算是便雅憫的一部分。

words.note: Used before measure words, 'two' in quantity.
Common measure word for people or general items.
Connects a modifier to the noun it describes.
Commonly used in biblical context for tribes.

verses.text: 比錄人原先逃到基他音，就在那裡寄居，直到今日。）

words.note: Often used in biblical texts for temporary dwelling or being a stranger.

verses.text: 掃羅的兒子約拿單有一個兒子，雙腿都跛了。掃羅和約拿單死亡的消息從耶斯列傳到的時候，他才五歲。他的乳母抱著他逃跑。乳母在慌忙中逃跑，孩子掉了下來，腿就瘸了。他的名字叫米非波設。

words.note: Forms a noun phrase from a verb phrase, here indicating 'the time when'.
Indicates that something happened later than expected or implies a small amount.
Historically common, less so in modern times.
Indicates an action in progress or a state.
Often follows a noun to indicate 'in the midst of'.

verses.text: 比錄人臨門的兒子利甲和巴拿出去，約在正午炎熱的時候，來到了伊施波設的家。伊施波設正在睡午覺。

words.note: Indicates an action is happening at that very moment.
Combined with 正 (zhèng) for emphasis on ongoing action.

words.definition: take a nap, sleep in the afternoon

verses.text: 他們進了屋裡，假裝要拿麥子，就刺透伊施波設的肚腹，然後利甲和他的兄弟巴拿都逃脫了。

words.note: More formal than just '肚子 dùzi'.

verses.text: 他們進屋子的時候，伊施波設正在自己的臥室裡躺在床上，他們刺透他，把他殺死，然後割下他的頭，拿著頭顱在亞拉巴的路上走了一夜，

words.note: Forms '...的時候' (when...)

words.definition: just at, in the process of

words.note: Marks direct object to be disposed of by verb.
Refers specifically to a severed head or skull.

verses.text: 把伊施波設的頭帶到希伯崙去見大衛，對王說：「你的仇敵掃羅過去常常尋索你的命。看哪！這是他兒子伊施波設的頭。今天耶和華在掃羅和他後裔的身上為我主我王報了仇了。」

words.note: Marks direct object to be disposed of by verb.
More formal or literary than '尋找' (xúnzhǎo).
Commonly used in biblical text for emphasis.
Transliteration of the Hebrew name for God.
Common biblical term for lineage.

verses.text: 大衛嚴懲刺殺伊施波設的人大衛回答比錄人臨門的兒子利甲和他的兄弟巴拿，說：「我指著那曾救贖我的命脫離一切患難的永活的耶和華起誓：

words.note: Connects verb phrase to noun.
Refers to people from Beeroth.
A core theological term.
Often used in religious contexts for suffering/hardship.
Connects descriptive clause to noun.
Typically used to describe God.
Connects adjective to noun.
Transliteration of the Hebrew name for God.
More formal than just '發誓' (fāshì).

verses.text: 從前有人向我報信說：『看哪！掃羅死了。』他自以為是報好消息，我卻抓住他，把他殺在洗革拉，這就是我給他作報好消息的酬報。

words.note: Commonly used in biblical text for emphasis.
A common idiom meaning to be opinionated or conceited.
Marks direct object to be disposed of by verb.
Verb-preposition compound indicating location of action.
Forms a noun phrase from preceding clause.

verses.text: 何況惡人在義人的家裡，把義人殺在床上。現在我怎能不從你們手中追討流他血的罪，把你們從這世上除滅呢？」

words.note: Often used in contrast to 義人 (righteous person) in biblical contexts.
Refers to those who live righteously before God.
Rhetorical phrase, implying 'surely must'.
Often refers to power or control.
Here, specifically about blood.
Connects the phrase '流他血' to '罪'.
Often refers to moral or religious offense.
Strong verb, often used in divine judgment.

verses.text: 於是，大衛吩咐年輕人把他們殺了，並且砍斷他們的手腳，把身體掛在希伯崙的水池旁邊；卻把伊施波設的頭拿去，埋葬在希伯崙押尼珥的墳墓裡。
